comment_text: proving product of matrix transpose is malicious and makes no sense at all, but such an instance clarifies everything.
When taking the product of two matrices, for your (ab)_ij value, is that essentially just the dot product of the ith row vector of a to the jth coleume vector of b?
you saved my life, thanks a lott!!

This is true for all non-commutive operations (i.e. groups ).  inv(A%B%C..)=
...inv(C)%inv(B)%inv(A).  You can see this with a Rubic Cube  To return back to the previous state, do the inverse of each step in reverse order .
